verb.description: Give all or a large part of one's time or resources to (a person, activity, or cause)
examples: I wanted to devote more time to my family

verb.description: Invoke or pronounce a curse upon.

origin: Late 16th century (in the sense dedicate formally, consecrate): from Latin devot- consecrated, from the verb devovere, from de- formally + vovere to vow.
